values.help: Choose if you want the Mini Plug to send metering reports to the controller.
values.label: Metering Reports

values.help: Choose how often you want the Mini Plug to send metering reports to the controller, in seconds.
values.label: Metering Reports Interval

values.help:
Percentage change of elecricity, voltage, power consumption, or energy before report is sent.
                Defaults to 5%.
values.label: Power Reporting Percentage Threshold

values.help:
Use this parameter to adjust the max amount of electricity you want your Mini Plug to handle, by Amperes.
                Defaults to 13A.
values.label: Overload Protection

values.help:
Use this parameter to adjust the LED Notification for Heavy Load by setting a threshold of Amperes.
                Must be lower than Parameter #3.
                Defaults to 12A
values.label: LED Notifications - Heavy Load

values.help: Use this parameter to turn LED notifications on or off.
values.label: LED Notifications

values.help:
Choose the recovery state for the Mini Plug if power outage occurs. Off sets the state to "OFF" once power is restored.
                Resume sets the state to the previous state prior to the outage.
                Defaults to Resume.
values.label: On/Off Status After Power Failure

values.help:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer function.
                If enabled, the Mini Plug will automatically turn off after a fixed period of time, set in Parameter #9.
                Defaults to Disabled.
values.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer

values.help:
Use this parameter to set the time, in minutes, after which the Mini Plug should turn off if Auto Turn-Off Timer is Enabled (Parameter #8).
                Defaults to 150 minutes.
values.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer Interval

values.help: Choose if you want the Z-Wave button to turn the Mini Plug on or off manually, or if you want to disable this function. Defaults to Enabled.
values.label: Manual Control
